result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 1:33 pm 
INCLUDES 15CM2030, 16CM1410, 16CM1591, 16CM490, AND 16CM135. 
State appears by ADA Kerri Puig; Def appears in person with Atty Amanda Ley.   
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. 

State moves to: 
In 15CM2030: Ct. 1 (Operate without valid license)>>D&RI. 
In 16CM1410: Ct. 1 (Operate without valid license)>>D&RI. 
                        : Cts. 2-4 (Misd. BJ)>>D&RI. 
In 16CM1591: Ct. 1 (Operate without valid license)>>D&RI. 
                       : Cts. 2-5 (Misd. BJ)>>D&RI. 
In 16CM135: Ct. 1 (Operate without valid license)>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: 
In 16CM490: Ct. 1 (Obstructing an Officer)>>NO CONTEST. 
                     : Ct. 2 (Operate without valid license)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 


COURT ORDERS: 
In 16CM490: Ct. 1>>CC; DNA sample and surcharge. 
                     : Ct. 2>>$50 plus CC; DNA sample and surcharge. 
COURT gives def 60 days to pay fine/costs or set up payment plan. 

Adj: 1:41 pm
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 7, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Clerk Marisa.

INCLUDES 16CM490, 16CM1410, 16CM135, AND 15CM2030. 
State appears by ADA Ralph Uttke; Deft appears in person with Atty Aaron Damrau. 
Atty Damrau makes statement. 
COURT vacates bond forfeiture. 
PTC set for 8/18/2016 at 9am.

Bail/Bond Forfeiture Hearing on August 9, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Jury Trial on September 28, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Clerk Marisa.
